intro: Spermacoce suaveolens f. glabra, commonly known as the smooth spermacoce, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glabrous, giving it its specific epithet "glabra." The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
